result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen J Hoffman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

All financials same as noted above.  
MUST submit DNA sample.

Domestic Violence assessment and follow through.  
Take all medications as prescribed.

Defendant Stephen J Hoffman in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Haacke recites offer made by ADA Niemi.  Court reviews rights, charges & penalties w/DE, accepts waiver, plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty.  VIS filed and reviewed by Court.  Sentencing arguments.  DE addresses the Court.  Court follows recommendation: 18 months -Count 1, 12 months count 2 - probation - w/h sentence, conditions:  psych assessment & follow-through, Take all medication as prescribed, DV assessment & follow-through, $10 plus costs on each count, DNA sample & surcharge.  No jail credit.  Appeal rights given to DE.

Defendant Stephen J Hoffman in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Requests bond be modified to make contact consistent w/family order.  ADA Niemi recommends "No harrassing contact" No need for third party child exchange.  Court allow bond to be amended : "No harassing or violent contact with E.R., must follow all rules of mediated settlement"  All other conditions of bond remain.  Next date to be set with JA.

Defendant Stephen J Hoffman in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to counsel given - defendant proceeds w/o counsel.  Court accepts waiver of attorney for now.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest.  Court explains rights and then provided probation info to the defendant to read over.  Defendant changes his mind and withdraws his plea and wants to now speak with counsel.  Doesn't want the no contact implemented.  Court explains Safe Haven procedure and orders a no contact.  Victim witness to notify victim of waiver process. Court amends bond to include no contact.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
